messages.message: Hey, when using Converse on a smaller screen than our macs the new examples and best practices section doesn’t fit in the space properly which means sections of it are cut off. Could we add something to handle the smaller screens better? For example removing the icons above the titles for each section?

Thanks Lee!  This has been addressed in the upcoming release. Can you please check in DEV/UAT and provide your feedback.

https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/
https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/
Hey @Balaram I can see a slight improvement but the issue is still there. Below are my screenshots on prod and UAT.
@Balaram - We can put the icons for best practices and examples side by side with the text to save space and make the UX scale down better. What do you think?
Also I know i’m a huge pedant (can’t help it) but the text isn’t centred vertically in the box. You can see with the blue highlighting that the text is bottom aligned in its div.

Also the line break can happen between the text and the arrow icon, which looks a bit strange when its on a line of its own. I think it would look better if the arrow was in a column of its own to the right, and vertically centered in the rounded box.
@Lee thanks for being a pedant, and pushing on every detail! Keep the feedback coming. @Balaram lets track and improve this in the next release (23.37)

Here’s an example of what I meant.

1. on `.fdFhzY` i added `display: flex;` and changed the padding from `padding: 16px 0px;` to `padding: 16px *16px;*`
2. Then on the svg element I added `flex: 0 0 2em;` to make all the arrows be the same size.
Thanks for your feedback! We will look into this. @Prakhar
